textos_fuente.text: Board of Directors & Staff - Camp New York Please ensure Javascript is enabled for purposes of website accessibility Skip to content Request a Guide About About Us Board of Directors & Staff CONY Hall of Fame & CONY Fellows Job Postings News Events CONY Members Support Camp Good Days Blog Hot Deals Member Center Affiliate Members Member Enrollment Marketing Opportunities Programs COVID-19 Resources Join Today Membership Benefits Member Enrollment Member Login Find a Campground Board of Directors & Staff Established in 1963, Campground Owners of New York, Inc. (CONY) is a for-profit trade association dedicated to the promotion, growth, improvement, and development of independently owned campgrounds in New York State. Two full-time staff persons manage the day-to-day operations of the association. The board of directors is comprised of campground owners or managers representing designated regions across the entire state, plus an executive committee of campground operators. Office location and correspondence: 100 Saratoga Village Blvd, Ste 37S Malta, New York 12020 info@campnewyork.com , 585-586-4360 Staff Emily Simmons President & CEO 585-586-4360 emily@campnewyork.com Ann Flach Marketing & Communications Manager 585-586-4360, ext 2 ann@campnewyork.com Board of Directors (2024-2025) Chairman: Matt Anderson Camp Chautauqua Stow, NY mda1223@yahoo.com Executive Committee Chair 1 st Vice Chair: Vacant 2 nd Vice Chair: Nina Latello Sleepy Hollow Lake Resort Akron, NY sleepyhollowlake@yahoo.com Marketing Committee Chair 3 rd Vice Chair: Patty Jarnot Dream Lake Campground Warsaw, NY patty@dreamlakecampground.com Governance Committee Chair Immediate Past Chair: Scott Sherwood Spruce Row Campground & RV Park Ithaca, NY sprucerow1@gmail.com Executive Committee Member Treasurer: Edward Marden Camp Bell Campground Campbell, NY ed@campbellcampground.com Executive Committee Member Secretary: Bryan Schaefer Jones Pond Campground & RV Park Angelica, NY √Ç¬†bryan@jonespond.com Executive Committee Member Regional Directors Chautauqua-Allegheny: John Tinelli Triple R Camping Resort & Trailer Sales Franklinville, NY Counties: Allegany, Cattaraugus, Chautauqua. Beach Camp Brewing Co - Beer from Here ‚Äî Beach Camp 0 Skip to Content Our Beer Story Visit Happy Hour Events Grayton Events Parties & Catering Food Truck MENUS Open Menu Close Menu Our Beer Story Visit Happy Hour Events Grayton Events Parties & Catering Food Truck MENUS Open Menu Close Menu Our Beer Story Visit Happy Hour Folder: Events Back Grayton Events Parties & Catering Food Truck MENUS Our beer Where to find Beach camp Beer You can find Beach Camp Beer in 6 packs at 6 Wine World locations from Panama City Beach to Pensacola! Our 6 packs, crowlers, growlers, and drafts are all available at the Brewpubs. (+ More retailers coming soon!) Click to find Wine world near you! What‚Äôs on tap? We‚Äôve got magic brewing in our tanks! A broad range of in-house brews are available at both of our Beach Camp Brewpub locations, as well as a limited selection offered at multiple restaurants and bars on the Gulf Coast, including The Craft Bar. Crab Island Blonde Ale Blonde Ale - 5.3% ABV - 18 IBU Watch your toes! The Crab Island Blonde Ale pinches with a bready and light profile. Balanced and easy sipping! Probably, the best Blonde Ale on the Emerald Coast. Souvenir IPA IPA - American - 7.2% ABV - 58 IBU Get me a Souvenir! Drink this beer at the beach, and bring it home to share! Enjoy the apricot and sweet melon flavors with a pleasantly bitter and dry finish for a Citra hop expression. High Tide Hefe Wheat Beer - Hefeweizen - 5.7% ABV - 19 IBU Clove and bubblelicious on the nose with banana-o-ramo on the palate. Dank Sinatra IPA - American - 7.01% ABV - 45 IBU So dankin‚Äô good! Juicy IPA at its best! Amber-Jack Amber Ale - 6.5% ABV - 27 IBU Malty in your mouth, followed by a mildly bitter finish that we recommend pairing with our pulled pork sandwich. Delicious! ‚Äòcause we can! Two Beach Camp favorites are now available in 12oz, 6 pack cans! Take the Beach home with you - stop at the brewpubs or a retailer near you today! Crab Island Blonde Ale Blonde Ale - 5.3% ABV - 18 IBU Watch your toes! The Crab Island Blonde Ale pinches with a bready and light profile. Balanced and easy sipping! Probably, the best Blonde Ale on the Emerald Coast. Souvenir IPA IPA - American - 7.2% ABV - 58 IBU Get me a Souvenir! Drink this beer at the beach, and bring it home to share! Enjoy the apricot and sweet melon flavors with a pleasantly bitter and dry finish for a Citra hop expression. Limited Release Get them while you can! This selection of seasonal and special brews won‚Äôt last long. Uncle Dunkel Wheat Beer - Dunkelweizen - 4.78% ABV - 10 IBU Uncle‚Äôs dark hefe with malty goodness! Bread crust and caramel. This is a Farmhouse...Ale Farmhouse Ale - Saison - 5.9% ABV - 21 IBU This Belgian style puts off a mild earthy hop aroma with hints of black pepper, citrus, and banana. Marzen the Martian M√§rzen - 6.2% ABV - 19 IBU Sweet apricot for a malty, clean, and rich aftertaste! Mozart Smash Lager- Vienna - 6.3% ABV - 24 IBU Our latest addition to our series of SMSH beers combines Vienna Malt with Czech Saaz hops. Herbal aroma with a mild earthy bitterness and a slight malty sweetness. Beach Camp ESB Bitter- Extra Special - 5.75% ABV - 45 IBU Aroma of sweet hay and grain. Malty sweetness greets the palate, followed by a mild bitterness over the tongue, then an effervescent and creamy finish. Ale I Want For Christmas Red Ale - 7.92% ABV - 58 IBU A punch of clove due to the phenols created by the wheat beer yeast. To balance the spice, we added blood orange to the tank. Holiday simmer in the pot! The Bold Brew Coffee Porter Porter - Coffee - 6.7% ABV - 7 IBU A local coffee shop provided us with some amazing Guatemalan Roast to release a wake me up brew! Cheers! COMING SOON Stout Walton Long Strange Tripel Pilsner Doppelbock Meet the brewers Will Dargavell Brewmaster A South Walton local, Will began brewing beer nearly a decade ago in his college home at the University of Florida. He moved to Sonoma County, where he honed his skills through work at local wineries. Through this, he realized ‚Äúit takes good beer to make great wine‚Äù and knew that his passion lied in those industries. Moving back to South Walton, Will sought to provide great beer to the local community he knew and loved - and began as assistant brewer at Beach Camp before quickly moving up to his current Brewmaster position where he creates unique recipes and aims to brew some of the best beer the Emerald Coast has to offer. Chase Boutwell Assistant Brewer Chase Boutwell is an Okaloosa County native. Born at Eglin AFB and graduated from Choctawhatchee High School in 2008. A bartender‚Äôs bartender with over a decade of experience. A true local with a passion of knowledge and craft beer, he can come up with a beer name almost as well as he can drink it. Committed to brewing the best beer on the beach! LEAD STAFF Will Dargavell Brewmaster Chase Boutwell Assistant Brewer Justin Grev Creative Director RECENT PRESS Featured on 30A.com Gallery State of the art brewing facilities Visit the Brewpubs work with us! OUR TEAM | CAMP top of page Home ABOUT OUR TEAM JOIN THE TEAM PROGRAMS TACT URBAN ARTS NORTHERN LIGHTS BLUEGRASS MUSIC CAMP GIRLS ROCK THE NORTH YOUTH MUSIC CAMPS RESIDENCIES CULTURAL FOUNDATIONS MUSIC IN SCHOOLS ARTS EXPLORATION TOUR SOA FIDDLE MENTORSHIP CURRICULUM DEVELOPMENT HIP HOP COLLABORATION MUSIC TEACHER MENTORSHIP CONTACT NEWS DOYLEFEST LINEUP AND TICKETS ABOUT GET INVOLVED GALLERY CONTACT PAST PERFORMERS DONATE Our Team. Rooted in the arts. Experts in various fields, working together to share their talents in communities across Saskatchewan. Eliza Doyle managingdirector@communityartsmentorship.com Co - Founder / Managing Director Eliza is a professional musician, songwriter and recording artist, teacher, community advocate, leader and is the co-founder behind Saskatchewan‚Äôs arts organization, C.A.M.P; Community Arts Mentorship Program. Her focus on fostering the arts while supporting local community capacity to deliver arts programming has been welcomed throughout communities in Saskatchewan. Offering services to remote and under-served communities presents new challenges, and all of CAMP programming serves to mitigate these obstacles. Familiar with the arts and music industry in Saskatchewan, she also aims to provide the opportunity and mentorship available to people with challenges in access due to location and lack of resources. Holly Rae Yuzicapi culturalengagement@communityartsmentorship.com Co - Founder / Cultural Consultant The co-founder of CAMP and a proud Dakota/Lakota from the Standing Buffalo Dakota Nation in Treaty 4 Territory, Saskatchewan.¬† Holly grew up in the beautiful Qu'Appelle valley.¬† Coming from a large family, Holly has been able to observe and learn from many generations of the Goodwill and Yuzicapi families.¬† The strength of her sense of identity was nurtured and shaped by her family and community.¬† Without realizing it at the time, Holly started doing cultural arts sharing from a young age which really is rooted in participating in powwow dancing and attending other cultural events on a regular basis.¬† She has evolved into an independent natural materials artist that loves to facilitate cultural arts engagement opportunities to all audiences.¬† Holly is proud of how she was raised and is very thankful for all that her family has taught her.¬† Respectfully representing the spirit and potential of those teachings is why Holly does the work that she does.¬† It is how she chooses to honour her family. LJ Tyson Kimbley innovationliaison@communityartsmentorship.com Innovation Liaison LJ Tyson is a singer-songwriter from Prince Albert, Saskatchewan. The has used his identity as inspiration for creating lyrics and melodies. LJ has had music played across Canada and beyond. His latest release Home On A Rainbow was critically acclaimed and awarded a prize from SOCAN TD Indigenous Songwriter Awards. LJ currently works as Innovation Liaison for Community Arts mentorship program, bringing music to remote and underserved communities. Steph Cameron administrativedirector@communityartsmentorship.com Administrative Director Saskatchewan-based artist Steph Cameron has gained recognition for her unique take on contemporary Americana music, lively instrumentation, and captivating lyrics. From her early days of busking, she has become an internationally touring professional recording artist. Her critically acclaimed debut album, Sad-Eyed Lonesome Lady, released on Pheromone Recordings in 2014, was nominated for the Polaris Music Prize and praised as the #1 Canadian album of that year by PopMatters, while No Depression called it "a stunning debut." This success led her to join the Paquin Artist Agency and embark on national tours. Her expertise in performing is the real world experience CAMP participants benefit the most from . Zoe Slusar programcoordinator@communityartsmentorship.com Program Coordinator Zoe Slusar was the voice actress for Kid Goku in the English dubs of the Dragon Ball and Dragon Ball GT anime, done by Blue Water Studios. She also provided the voice of Sai Saici in Kidou Butouden G Gundam, as well as the video game Gundam: Battle Assault 2.

Zoe also voiced the character Jungo in the Flemish created series.

Zoe, also known by her stage name ZHE the Free, released her first rap EP album titled The Love EP in September 2020. This album charted #1 on 90.9 CJSW in Calgary, Alberta in November 2020. Mitchell Dureault programcoordinator@communityartsmentorship.com Program Coordinator Mitch Dureault is a seasoned professional music instructor and traditional musician, who comes from the Treaty 4 Territory of the southern Saskatchewan prairies. Currently sitting as a board member, and working instructor for C.A.M.P., Mitch is an advocate for the arts and has a strong focus on decolonizing his own music & teaching practices. He regularly draws from his B.A. in International Studies while working with and aiding organisations, communities, and schools in the development and implementation of equitable and continual art programming throughout the province. Mitch is also very passionate about the promotion and preservation of the local culture of Saskatchewan fiddling and has been making efforts to visit and interview as many fiddlers as possible from across the province for his Saskatchewan Fiddle History Project, a multi-year project in which he collects stories, tunes, and histories from these individuals in an attempt to preserve and document the ever evolving diverse intricacies of the provinces fiddling culture. Jille Shotton communications@communityartsmentorship.com sponsorship@communityartsmentorship.com‚Äã Marketing and Communications Director\ Sponsorship Jille Shotton joined the Community Arts Mentorship Program in 2024 as the Marketing and Communications Director, bringing a decade of experience in festival marketing, promotions, and community building within Saskatchewan's arts and culture sector. Her background includes managing marketing, communications, sponsorship, and onsite operations for events such as the Northern Lights Bluegrass & Old Time Music Festival, Winterruption, Ness Creek Music Festival, Fiddlyness, Shivering Strings and the Children's Festival of Saskatchewan. Jille is passionate about strengthening communities through the arts, having organized open jams, Bluegrass Brunch, radio shows, and various events and festivals. Her work focuses on creating inclusive, vibrant spaces where the community can connect and thrive. Lillanohna Naytowhowcon President LILI, an Indigenous singer, songwriter, and recording artist hailing from Sturgeon Lake First Nation in Saskatchewan, blends her passion for music and independent songwriting. She is actively engaged in community projects that celebrate and honour Indigenous culture through a fusion of traditional Cree songs, indie rock, folk, hip-hop, and dance music.¬†In 2024, expect the release of her music under the esteemed blessed-street record label, marking a significant chapter in her musical journey. The album includes collaboration with recording artist Lancelot Knight in Six Underwater, showcasing her versatility. Proudly identifying as a nehiyaw iskwew, she seamlessly weaves her creative pursuits into a traditional lifestyle, contributing to a First Nation Healing Lodge under the guidance of elders and knowledge keepers.¬†The past year has been a transformative period characterized by healing and growth, with her music echoing the spirit of loss, hope, and perseverance. Her vocal style is both distinctive and heartfelt, drawing inspiration from grassroots music festivals, independent artists, and the eclectic vibes of the city. A nomadic spirit with a touch of witchy charm, LILI invites all to partake in the enchantment of her melodies. Travis Beatty Board Member Travis Beatty is from Timber Bay, Saskatchewan and is instrumentalist. He has a studio in Saskatoon, Saskatchewan called Rez Rat Recording, and is passionate about helping community and youth in Saskatchewan. He joined the CAMP Sask Arts Board of Directors in October 2023, and we are very lucky to have him! JOIN THE MAILING LIST SIGN UP NOW Thanks to our supporting organizations Email: managingdirector@communityartsmentorship.com Tel: 306-774-5888 bottom of page

Brewery in Wells, Maine | Batson River Fish Camp Skip to content LOCATIONS & HOURS BIDDEFORD KENNEBUNK PORTLAND WELLS EVENTS BIDDEFORD CALENDAR KENNEBUNK CALENDAR PORTLAND CALENDAR WELLS CALENDAR PRIVATE EVENTS BEER & SPIRITS OUR SPIRITS OUR BEERS WHAT‚ÄôS ON TAP IN BIDDEFORD WHAT‚ÄôS ON TAP IN KENNEBUNK WHAT‚ÄôS ON TAP IN PORTLAND WHAT‚ÄôS ON TAP IN WELLS BREWERY TOURS MENUS BIDDEFORD MENU KENNEBUNK MENU PORTLAND MENU WELLS MENU RESERVATIONS BIDDEFORD PORTLAND GIFT CARDS √ó LOCATIONS & HOURS BIDDEFORD KENNEBUNK PORTLAND WELLS EVENTS BIDDEFORD CALENDAR KENNEBUNK CALENDAR PORTLAND CALENDAR WELLS CALENDAR PRIVATE EVENTS BEER & SPIRITS OUR SPIRITS OUR BEERS WHAT‚ÄôS ON TAP IN BIDDEFORD WHAT‚ÄôS ON TAP IN KENNEBUNK WHAT‚ÄôS ON TAP IN PORTLAND WHAT‚ÄôS ON TAP IN WELLS BREWERY TOURS MENUS BIDDEFORD MENU KENNEBUNK MENU PORTLAND MENU WELLS MENU RESERVATIONS BIDDEFORD PORTLAND GIFT CARDS Batson River Fish Camp ‚Äì Wells, Maine Wells has been a summertime hotspot for generations, and we‚Äôre excited to add our brand of year-round flavor. Located just off Route 1 on the way to one of the best beaches in southern Maine, Batson River Fish Camp in Wells, Maine is the perfect place to refuel and recharge when you‚Äôre sightseeing, adventuring, or exploring this iconic area and nearby Ogunquit. Expect a delicious menu of New American Pub Fare along with a carefully curated selection of cocktails using housemade spirits as well as a selection of craft beers brewed on site. This location houses our brewery and production facility which can be viewed during a brewery tour! Beach Camp is a Wine World Restaurant & part of the Coastal Restaurant Group ‚Äî Beach Camp 0 Skip to Content Our Beer Story Visit Happy Hour Events Grayton Events Parties & Catering Food Truck MENUS Open Menu Close Menu Our Beer Story Visit Happy Hour Events Grayton Events Parties & Catering Food Truck MENUS Open Menu Close Menu Our Beer Story Visit Happy Hour Folder: Events Back Grayton Events Parties & Catering Food Truck MENUS About Wine World‚Äôs Coastal Restaurant Group Thank you for enjoying the Wine World Lifestyle with us at a Wine World Coastal Restaurant Group location, where culinary excellence meets warm hospitality. Our group comprises three unique dining destinations: The Wine Bar, The Craft Bar, and Beach Camp Brewpub. Each of our establishments is dedicated to creating memorable experiences, serving our community, and treating every guest like a cherished neighbor. Our Philosophy Wine World‚Äôs Coastal Restaurant Group all believe that great food and drink bring people together. Our menus are crafted with fresh, locally sourced ingredients, ensuring every dish is as vibrant and dynamic as the community we serve. Our chefs take pride in transforming these ingredients into culinary delights that excite the senses and leave a lasting impression. Exceptional Drink Offerings Our drink lists are as renowned as our food. Whether you're a wine connoisseur, a cocktail enthusiast, or a craft beer lover, you'll find something to love at our establishments. The Wine Bar boasts an ever-evolving selection of fine wines from around the world, perfectly curated to complement any meal. The Craft Bar is known for its innovative cocktails, expertly mixed to delight and surprise. At Beach Camp Brewpub, our locally brewed craft beers are a testament to our dedication to quality and flavor, offering a range of styles to suit every palate. A Place for Everyone We take immense pride in being an excellent place to work, fostering a positive and inclusive environment for our team members. Our commitment to exceptional service and community spirit is evident in everything we do, from the welcoming atmosphere to the personalized attention each guest receives. Join Us We invite you to explore each of our unique dining experiences: Visit The Wine Bar: Discover an exquisite selection of wines and a menu designed to elevate your dining experience. Visit The Wine Bar Visit The Craft Bar: Experience innovative cocktails and a vibrant atmosphere where creativity and flavor come together. Visit The Craft Bar Visit Wine World: A favorite stop for Locals and Visitors, Wine World has Spirits, Beer, Gourmet Cheeses, and of course, a carefully curated selection of wines from the most rare to the best bang for the buck. Visit Wine World Thank you for choosing Beach Camp Brewpub, an essential part of the Wine World Restaurant Group. We look forward to welcoming you and making every visit a memorable one. work with us! Summer Employment at Camp BB Riback The traditions of Camp BB Riback are maintained and enhanced every summer by the enthusiasm and creativity of new and returning staff and campers. A role on the staff team at Camp is a great responsibility and a great opportunity. Make a difference for yourself and those you serve ‚Äì a summer at Camp BB Riback is not just a summer of fun‚Ä¶it is a lifetime of friendships, memories, traditions and skills! Apply today! Examples of common positions at Camp BB Riback include: Job Listings Leadership Team (Manager, Assistant Director) Senior Staff Team ‚Äì Camper Unit Coordinator Senior Staff Team ‚Äì Specialty/Activity Area Sr. Specialist Waterfront Specialist ‚Äì Power Boat, Water Ski, Wake Board Paddle Sports (Canoe/Kayak) Specialist Pool Specialist Horseback Riding Specialist Altitude (High Ropes, Zip Line, Climbing Wall) Specialist Bikes Specialist Discovery (Outdoor Education/Tripping) Specialist Performing Arts Specialist (Musicals & Drama) Creative Arts Specialist (Pottery, Arts & Crafts, etc.) Media Specialist (Camp Photographer/Videographer, AV Specialist, etc.) Bunk/Cabin Counsellor Office & Administration Maintenance Kitchen Staff (Chef, Assistant Cook, Kitchen help, Dishwashers) Camp Nurse/Medic Summer 2025 Staff Application It is important to note that all staff at Camp BB Riback are COUNSELLORS FIRST. This means that the #1 priorities of all persons on the staff team are the safety, health, and happiness of our campers, regardless of areas of responsibility or the specifics of individual job descriptions. It is also possible that ANY staff member may be asked and/or required to provide care for, supervision of, or reside with campers. All staff are also expected to contribute effort and attention to the overall functioning of our programs and services and to assist with the cleaning and maintenance of the facilities and properties when required. Please read and complete this form carefully. Incomplete applications may not be processed. Some positions may require employees that are 18 years of age or older or require specific certifications or experience. Applicants must currently be completing Grade 11 or older. Applications will be reviewed as they come in. Interviews and employment offers may take place as soon as suitable candidates are identified. PREFERENCE MAY BE GIVEN TO EARLY APPLICANTS . Some positions may be filled before the application deadlines (so please apply early) and some positions may remain open past deadlines until suitable candidates are found. Thank you for your interest in employment at Camp BB Riback. If you have any questions or would like to recommend candidates please contact the Director, Stacy Shaikin at shaikin@campbb.com or the camp office at 587-988-9771. To include a cover letter, resume or other documents in your application please email it to the Camp Office. Telephone: 587-988-9771 Tel. Toll Free: 1-800-267-2267 Fax: 1-888-896-9771 Email: info@campbb.com Web: www.campbb.com **TO PRINT OR SAVE A COPY FOR YOUR RECORDS (optional). Each section/page must be printed or saved separately.
